intro: Meibomia subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Meibomia subsessilis is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
